name: Kimchi Jjigae
description: A hearty, spicy stew made with kimchi, tofu, pork (or seafood), and various seasonings, typically served boiling hot.
steps: In a pot, saut√© pork belly until browned, then add chopped kimchi and cook until soft.
Add water or stock and bring to a boil.
Season with gochujang, gochugaru (Korean chili powder), and soy sauce.
Add sliced tofu and simmer until all ingredients are well-cooked.
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve hot with a bowl of rice.
tips: Use well-fermented kimchi for a deeper flavor.
Adjust the amount of gochujang and gochugaru to control the spice level.
The stew tastes better the longer it sits, making it a great leftover dish.
